result.execSummary:
The defendant Glen A Valadez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Concurrent with: with Count 2

Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: to time now serving

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample if not previously provided.  Pay assessed surcharge.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Must not associate with any members of the Maniac Latin Disciples.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to time now serving

Defendant Glen A Valadez in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Glen A Valadez in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: *****AMENDED CRIMINAL COMPLAINT ATTACHED***   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  No contact with the witnesses  AJ, JR (person, property, residence or family).   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
